text: Yes, Currently we are manually recording all sales activities in each custom object, but we are not able to get the report of calls, meetings, emails associated with each custom object.... Is programmable with the API? :slightly_smiling_face:

A custom object can associate with sales activities ???
How? with the  API ...
Just use the associations api
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

You will need to send a GET request to the schema's api to find out what the association type ids are for example I have a Custom Object called cohorts and to associate it to a note I need to use the association type id 30
Here's the schemas api: <https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/schemas>
Here's the docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects#endpoint?spec=GET-/crm/v3/schemas>
Ok I'll do a test to see if we can solve it with this... thank you very much I'll tell you things :grinning:
For sure, and if you need I can hop on a quick call and help you out
Can you connect with us today :sweat_smile: Please ?
Don´t find the correct way ... The objects of sales activities to asociate the custom object
Sure you can grab some time from the calendar in my bio
Hi

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Hi, I'm trying to retrieve call data through the following url

`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/calls/>`

However I'm not receiving the full property related data as should be getting the following data (As detailed in the documentation)

```{
  "properties": {
    "hs_timestamp": "2021-03-17T01:32:44.872Z",
    "hs_call_title": "Discovery call",
    "HubSpot_owner_id": "11349275740",
    "hs_call_body": " Decision maker out, will call back tomorrow",
    "hs_call_duration": "3800",
    "hs_call_from_number": "(857) 829 5489",
    "hs_call_to_number": "(509) 999 9999",
    "hs_call_recording_url": "<https://api.twilio.com/2010-04-01/Accounts/[SECRET]/Recordings/RE3079ac919116b2d22>",
    "hs_call_status": "COMPLETED"```
However I'm receiving the following property related fields

`{'hs_createdate' 'hs_lastmodifieddate', 'hs_object_id'}`



Is there a reason why I am receiving  only a small amount of fields?


Many thanks,

Kamran
Can you post your request? there's probably an error with the properties you are requesting
So HubSpot is ignoring them. Make sure to remove keys

Are you using the
`?properties=hs_call_body,hs_call_title`
parameter?
You just need to comma seperate the properties that you want returned

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>

That seemed to do the trick.
No problem

Awesome, make sure to copy the request from the documentation so you can see how exactly it needs to be sent. If the property payload has an error or its missing it will only give you the default ones which are usually very limited.
<@U03BA1PRV7S> It's not a problem of it being a bad request
Not here but it could be
It the api returns data you're probably doing something right, if it doesn't you're doing something wrong. The API is returning data in this case
Yeah it wasnt the case I get it lol
You can make the form a HS form or use the Contacts API to create or update a Contact after signing up. You can even use the forms API to simulate a form submission.

Hi, any idea of how I can create a contact without an email using the API?
I m getting this response:
- Missing value of required parameter 'email'.

The extract to pull the CRM “companies” is working fine.  The GET code is shown below.

--request GET '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/companies?limit=100>'

However, the “companies” extract only returns the following data fields:
id
createdate
comain
hs_lastmodifieddate
hs_object_id
name
createdAt
updatedAt
archived

So none of the custom attributes are returned.

We tried doing the GET request to pull ALL of the custom schemas, using the code below, but the response back was : {"results":[]}

--request GET '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas>'
The companies api is only supposed to return those properties

To have it return more properties use the properties param. Like this:
`?properties=hs_owner_id`
comma separate the properties you want returned

And I just used the /schemas api this morning so I know it's working without any issues. To pull the schema for a specific object type just use `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/{objecttypeid}>`
Thanks for the quick response. Will try.
No problem, let me know if you need to hop on a quick zoom for me to walk you through it
Ok, how do we know what all of the different property names are if we can’t pull the schemas?
Or do I just go by the naming conventions I have in HubSpot
You might be calling the schemas api wrong
Can you share a screenshot?
I just tested it and it's working fine
Does your private app token have access to the schema api? You wouldn't get the above error if you didn't but just wanted to make sure that error was the actual error
I mean, these are all the scopes on

`integration-synccrm.lists.readcrm.objects.contacts.readcrm.schemas.custom.readcrm.objects.custom.readsettings.users.readcrm.schemas.contacts.readcrm.objects.companies.readcrm.schemas.companies.readcrm.objects.owners.readsettings.users.teams.read`
Yep so you should be good on the auth front
